newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China firms will not exploit post-97 HK - businessman.
newsitem.headline: China firms will not exploit post-97 HK - businessman.

text.p: China-funded enterprises will not seek special treatment in Hong Kong after the British territory reverts to Beijing's control this year, a leading Chinese businessman was quoted as saying on Saturday.

The Chinese-backed newspaper Ta Kung Pao quoted China Merchant Holdings Co Ltd president Li Yinfei as saying his firm and other state-owned enterprises would continue to abide by Hong Kong's rules when doing business in the territory after the July 1 handover.
Li told a business seminar on Hong Kong in the Chinese capital that Beijing-funded companies would not try to seek special privileges.

Hong Kong, a British colony for over 150 years, reverts to China at midnight on June 30. China has pledged to grant Hong Kong a high degree of autonomy and to retain its capitalist system for 50 years after the handover. But some pro-democracy politicians in Hong Kong fear that Chinese companies will try to exploit the transition to gain an edge over their Hong Kong counterparts.
